title: Dr. Dan Albright on the Latest Technology in Knee Replacement Surgery
text:
Medical advancements in knee replacement products aren't always a good thing
 RALEIGH, NC, October 23, Dr. Dan Albright, Orthopedic Surgeon in Raleigh North Carolina explains the latest technology in knee replacement surgery . Dr. Albright specializes in both full and partial knee replacements. Many new patients seeking to relieve their knee pain, want to know how surgery has advanced over time.
In a recent interview, Dr. Albright talks about how the technology has been proven over decades of use. Every 5 to 10 years, knee replacement materials used are incrementally improving with new research and advancement in orthopedic surgery. It can be agreed that there are no "best" female or male knee products, instead, the material that works best has been used successfully on thousands of patients all across the United States and abroad.
Dr. Albright cautions patients who see marketing for the "latest" and "greatest". Using a knee replacement product that has a tried and true track record is the best suggestions given to patients.
If you are suffering from knee pain that is persistent and causing a quality of life issue, call Dr. Albright for a consultant to see if a full knee replacement or a partial knee replacement is a good option for you.
To watch the interview visit Dr. Albright's YouTube channel .
About Daniel Albright, MD
Daniel J Albright, MD is a board certified orthopedic surgeon, who completed two fellowships in spine surgery and total hip and knee replacements. Dr. Albright joined Raleigh Orthopaedic Clinic in 1994.
Dr. Albright completed his undergraduate degree at Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire, and attended Louisiana State School of Medicine in New Orleans. He completed his residency in orthopedic surgery at Yale-New Haven Hospital. Following residency, Dr. Albright obtained additional training in Spine Surgery at St. Luke's Medical in Cleveland, Ohio, and Knee & Hip Replacement and Revision Surgery at Massachusetts General Hospital.
